citation.text: Rapid monoterpene induction promotes the susceptibility of a novel host pine to mountain pine beetle colonization but not to beetle-vectored fungi

distribution.name: Cale_et_al_Bioassay_data.csv
distribution.description: Reproduction data for experiments investigating effects of monoterpene induction levels on the growth and reproduction of three mountain pine beetle-associated fungi: Grosmannia clavigera, Ophiostoma montium, and Leptographium longiclavatum. See README for descriptions of dataset variables.

distribution.name: Cale_et_al_Monoterpene_induction_data.csv
distribution.description: Reproduction data for concentrations of monoterpenes induced in response to Grosmannia clavigera inoculations in lodgepole and jack pine trees.  See README for description of dataset variables.
